alert.note: Alert for Sanilac (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 3:35PM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact northern Sanilac County through 430 PM EDT... At 334 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Forestville to near Deckerville to 8 miles west of Sandusky. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Forestville around 355 PM EDT. Deckerville around 400 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Tyre, Decker, Palms, Watertown, McGregor, Forester, Minden, Snover, Juhl and Elmer. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.
